message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: I am studying how partisan standoffs influence administrative efficiency and the macro-economy, so I need a quantitative overview of every federal government shutdown.

Please output one Markdown table with the columns, in this order:
 Start Date | End Date | Duration (days) | President |  Speaker of the House | Senate Majority Leader | Furloughed Employees | Estimated Loss (USD million) | Main Disputed Provisions |

Requirements:
1. Cover every officially recorded federal government shutdown between October 1976 and December 2024 (including October 1976 and December 2024).
2. Date should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.
3. Record the President, House and Senate leaders during the shutdown period.
4. For furloughed employees, give the exact number. If there is no exact number or there is no employee furloughed, fill in with "-".

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

To create the requested table, I will need to gather all relevant details for every federal government shutdown from October 1976 to December 2024.

<search>list of federal government shutdowns from October 1976 to December 2024</search>

Search query: list of federal government shutdowns from October 1976 to December 2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_shutdowns_in_the_United_States):
Government shutdowns in the United States - Wikipedia The most significant historical shutdowns include the shutdown under Donald Trump's second presidency, which began on October 1, 2025, and lasted for 43 days; ...

[Doc 2](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/10/1/a-history-of-us-government-shutdowns-every-closure-and-how-long-it-lasted):
A history of US government shutdowns: Every closure and how long ... The US government has had 20 funding gaps, resulting in 10 shutdowns since 1976, the longest lasting 35 days.

[Doc 3](https://www.thoughtco.com/government-shutdown-history-3368274):
The Full List of the 22 Government Shutdown in U.S. History 1977 (President Jimmy Carter): September 30 to October 13 - 12 days; 1976 (President Gerald Ford): September 30 to October 11 - 10 days. Updated by Robert ...

<search>details about each federal government shutdown including start date, end date, president, house speaker, senate leader, number of furloughed employees, estimated loss, main disputed provisions</search>

Search query: details about each federal government shutdown including start date, end date, president, house speaker, senate leader, number of furloughed employees, estimated loss, main disputed provisions
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_United_States_federal_government_shutdown):
2025 United States federal government shutdown - Wikipedia From October 1 to November 12, 2025, the federal government of the United States was shut down as Congress failed to pass appropriations legislation for the ...

[Doc 2](https://www.ncsl.org/in-dc/federal-government-shutdown-what-it-means-for-states-and-programs):
Federal Government Shutdown: What It Means for States and ... NCSL reports on how the Oct. 1, 2025, federal government shutdown impacts discretionary and mandatory program funding, federal employees and state budgets.

[Doc 3](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/01/government-shutdown-trump-live-updates.html):
Government shutdown 2025: Live updates, news and analysis - CNBC The full shutdown began after top Democrats and Republicans, including President Donald Trump, failed to agree on a short-term deal to keep the ...
